New Records: Austin Wells hit a go-ahead three-run homer in the seventh inning and added an RBI double in the eighth as the New York Yankees pulled away for a 10-4 victory over the Kansas City Royals.
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge hit a tying single off James McArthur
Austin Wells lifted a 2-1 fastball into the lower rows of the right field bleachers to push New York’s lead to 7-4
Hunter Renfroe led off the sixth with a homer to give the Royals a 4-3 lead
Alex Verdugo hit a two-run homer to give the Yankees a brief 3-2 lead
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team’s resilience after the comeback win
Aaron Boone highlighted Austin Wells’ impressive level of at-bat from the left side
Matt Quatraro felt good about James McArthur in the seventh inning but wasn’t able to put the Yankees away
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees surpassed last season’s win total and moved 1 1/2 games ahead of the Orioles in the AL East
The Royals lost their sixth straight road game and dropped 3 1/2 games behind Cleveland in the AL Central
The game was played at Yankee Stadium with a attendance of 35,308
Others: DJ LeMahieu was placed on the 10-day injured list and may miss the rest of the season
Jon Berti was activated after missing 90 games with a strained left calf
